did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: This collection documents the activism of November Belford West and her opposition to the death penalty.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by November Belford West.2007

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: November Belford is a longtime activist and opponent of capital punishment who married a Texas Death Row prisoner Bobby West in 1988; he was executed in 1997. November Belford West launched a newspaper with Bobby West called Endeavor and later started a second newspaper, The Gathering.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence; clippings; newsletters, ephemera and other materials from abolitionist organizations; copies of The Angolite and other publications, including original copies of Belford West's two newspapers. In addition, there is correspondence between West and Harold "Wili" Otey, executed by the state of Nebraska in 1994, and a collection of Otey's poems which he sent to West.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
